thread.title: Poll shows Jefferson Parish voters largely undecided on parish president's race
thread.title_full: Poll shows Jefferson Parish voters largely undecided on parish president's race | NOLA.com

author: Heather Nolan, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Poll shows Jefferson Parish voters largely undecided on parish president's race
text:
A survey of Jefferson Parish residents less than a month before the Oct. 24 election shows 44% of voters are undecided on the parish president's race.
Among voters who are decided, results show a majority support Kenner Mayor Mike Yenni.
The poll, released Thursday (Oct. 1), was conducted by JCM Analytics and Polling . It surveyed 630 Jefferson Parish residents Sept. 28-29.
The company polled a sample of "likely voter" households in the parish's five council districts. Of those polled, 55% were men and 45% were women.
&amp;amp;amp;lt;a href="https://assets.documentcloud.org/documents/2447630/jefferson-parish-president-executive-summary.pdf"&amp;amp;amp;gt;Jefferson Parish President Executive Summary (PDF)&amp;amp;amp;lt;/a&amp;amp;amp;gt; &amp;amp;amp;lt;br /&amp;amp;amp;gt; &amp;amp;amp;lt;a href="https://assets.documentcloud.org/documents/2447630/jefferson-parish-president-executive-summary.txt"&amp;amp;amp;gt;Jefferson Parish President Executive Summary (Text)&amp;amp;amp;lt;/a&amp;amp;amp;gt; Of voters polled, 32% said they would support Yenni if the election was today. Results should 18% would support Parish Councilman Elton Lagasse of River Ridge, 3% would support retired longshoreman Al Morella of Kenner, 2% would support former Lagasse aide Robin Christiana of Gretna and 1% support Vincent DeSalvo Jr. of Gretna.
JCM Analytics and Polling noted Yenni is dominant in the East Bank, while the West Bank is more closely divided.
